title: feat: Discourse plugin
body:
# Overview

I would like to propose a new plugin that would expose a Discourse provider for agents: https://www.discourse.org/

This would enable interesting use cases where agents could use LLM to provide summaries and insights into web3 governance since Discourse is used widely amongst DAOs in web3. Of course, the plugin can be used in a non web3 context too. 

## Describe the solution you'd like

I would like to fork this repo and add a global plugin that will serve discourse data via a provider that can be consumed by agents

Functional requirements:
- Integration into Discourse API
- Allow plugin consumers to specify environment variables for: Discourse API access and the target host targeting a specific discourse deployment. As a stretch, more than one discourse forum could be supported but it’s not clear how beneficial that would be and future users could create demand for that
- Integrate core endpoints or allow users to specify data they want to curate in the style of a topic pub / sub I.e LATEST_POSTS would tell the plugin to only fetch the latest posts for the agent

## Describe alternatives you've considered

After searching the issues and pull requests I couldn’t see one mentioning a discourse integration. 

## Additional Context
Not applicable at this moment

title: Debug logging no longer works when using pnpm start:debug target
body:
With develop v0.1.8+build.1-683-g4240c65b2
elizalogger debug statements are no longer showing.
Taking a look now

title: @elizaos/client-direct speak endpoint setting conflicting headers
body:
**Describe the bug**
Using "@elizaos/client-direct": "0.1.7", calling 
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

**To Reproduce**
1. Install @elizaos/client-direct
2. Making this request to the REST API 
```
curl --location 'http://localhost:3005/<AGENT_ID>/speak' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data '{
    "text": "Hello Sonya."
}'
```
The response has both Content-Length and `Transfer-Encoding": "chunked` headers set, which is invalid according to HTTP 1.1 protocol
<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Content-Length header should not be set. It is currently being automatically set by node, since the buffer size is known:
Could be fixed by:
```
                res.set({
                    "Content-Type": "audio/mpeg",
                    "Transfer-Encoding": "chunked", // Explicitly use chunked encoding
                });

                // Stream the audio buffer
                const audioStream = Buffer.from(audioBuffer);
                res.write(audioStream); // Write the audio data in chunks
                res.end(); // End the response
```
**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

title: Integration Tests are failing in CI
body:
**Describe the bug**
I can successfully run integration tests locally, but they are failing in CI with the following error:

```
Error: error occurred in dts build
    at Worker.<anonymous> (/home/runner/work/eliza/eliza/node_modules/tsup/dist/index.js:1541:26)
    at Worker.emit (node:events:513:28)
    at MessagePort.<anonymous> (node:internal/worker:267:53)
    at [nodejs.internal.kHybridDispatch] (node:internal/event_target:827:20)
    at MessagePort.<anonymous> (node:internal/per_context/messageport:23:28)
DTS Build error
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1.
```

This is failing on the build step and does not actually get to running the tests.
You can check any current PR as an example.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

**To Reproduce**

Submit a new PR.

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

**Expected behavior**

Integration tests should pass

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Additional context**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

title: Plugin-EVM: Error in swap handler
body: I am getting the following error when trying to swap tokens using the evm plugin: `Error in swap handler: SDK Execution Provider not found.` **To Reproduce** Add the EVM plugin to your character file, and prompt the agent to swap from ETH to USDC. **Expected behavior** The agent fails to swap the tokens with the following error: `Error in swap handler: SDK Execution Provider not found.` **Screenshots** **Additional context** The problem is most probably in the createConfig section for the LIFI SDK in the wallet.ts file.

title: Add support for DeepSeek API
body: **Well as you know that deepseek currently is performing pretty well enough and I guess many co developers would love to see DeepSeek API support in this framework as its free of cost and it would allow more developers to explore this framework by creating ai agents.**

comments.body: @TheRealShreyash It's already supported - https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/develop/packages/core/src/models.ts ( line 1022 ). Plus check the .env.example and you'll find the necessary config variables

title: LLM Often Overlooks GitBook Provider Output Due to Lack of Context
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

In the plugin-gitbook, the returned information is often overlooked by the LLM. This happens because the return lacks sufficient context, causing the LLM to downplay the significance of the GitBook provider’s output.

title: Error Installing @discordjs/opus - Binaries Not Found and Compilation Fails with node-gyp
body:
**Description**

Context

I’m experiencing issues installing the @discordjs/opus package in my project. The installation fails with an error stating that pre-built binaries are not available and that the compilation via node-gyp is unsuccessful.

Environment Details
	•	Operating System: macOS Ventura 14.2 (arm64)
	•	Node.js: 22.13.1 (also tested on v23.3.0)
	•	npm: 10.9.0
	•	node-gyp: 10.3.1
	•	Python: 3.12.6



**Observed Error**

`node-pre-gyp ERR! install response status 404 Not Found on https://github.com/discordjs/opus/releases/download/v0.9.0/opus-v0.9.0-node-v127-napi-v3-darwin-arm64-unknown-unknown.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp WARN Pre-built binaries not installable for @discordjs/opus@0.9.0 and node@22.13.1 (node-v127 ABI, unknown) (falling back to source compile with node-gyp)
...
clang++: error: no such file or directory: 'SSD/eliza-projects/token-ai/opus/node_modules/node-addon-api'
make: *** [Release/obj.target/opus/src/node-opus.o] Error 1`

Suspected Problem
	•	It seems that pre-built binaries for @discordjs/opus are not available for my Node.js version and architecture (Node 22.x on macOS arm64).
	•	Additionally, manual compilation fails due to errors with node-gyp.

Attempts to Resolve
	1.	Tried different Node.js versions (18.x, 20.x, 22.x, and 23.x).
	2.	Removed all dependencies and cleared cache:

**Request**

I would like to know if there is an official solution or recommendation for this issue. Additionally, it would be helpful to have support for pre-built binaries on modern architectures and recent Node.js versions.

Additional Logs

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

│ node-pre-gyp http GET https://github.com/discordjs/opus/releases/download/v0.9.0/opus-v0.9.0-node-v127-napi-v3-darwin-arm64-unknown-unknown.tar.gz

comments.author: Freytes
comments.body: @lucasdutracoelho theres a server/machine dependency missing. Once installed the issue will no longer occur.(https://linuxize.com/post/how-to-install-gcc-on-ubuntu-20-04/)

comments.author: lucasdutracoelho
comments.body:
@Freytes 


I am using macOS with the following development tools already installed:
gcc:

```
Apple clang version 16.0.0 (clang-1600.0.26.6)  
Target: arm64-apple-darwin24.2.0  
Thread model: posix  
InstalledDir: /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin  
```


make:

```
GNU Make 3.81  
Copyright (C) 2006 Free Software Foundation, Inc.  
This program built for i386-apple-darwin11.3.0  
```



Despite having these tools installed, I am still encountering issues when trying to install the @discordjs/opus package. The following error is returned:

node-pre-gyp ERR! install response status 404 Not Found on https://github.com/discordjs/opus/releases/download/v0.9.0/opus-v0.9.0-node-v127-napi-v3-darwin-arm64-unknown-unknown.tar.gz
node-pre-gyp WARN Pre-built binaries not installable for @discordjs/opus@0.9.0 and node@22.13.1 (node-v127 ABI, unknown) (falling back to source compile with node-gyp)
clang++: error: no such file or directory: 'SSD/eliza-projects/token-ai/opus/node_modules/node-addon-api'
make: *** [Release/obj.target/opus/src/node-opus.o] Error 1

I have also tested with other versions of Node.js, including the recommended ones, but the issue persists. Is there anything additional I need to configure in the environment or any adjustments in the compilation process that could resolve this?

comments.author: 0xGuybrush
comments.body:
I'm getting an issue with the same package during a Docker build under WSL on Windows (Ubuntu 24.0.4):

> ENOENT Command failed with ENOENT: `git ls-remote https://github.com/discordjs/opus.git HEAD`
> spwan git ENOENT
>
> This error happened while installing a direct dependency of /app/packages/client-discord
>
> pnpm: Command failed with ENOENT: `git ls-remote https://github.com/discordjs/opus.git HEAD`
> spawn git ENOENT
>    at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal.child_process:286:19)

Works fine on the parent box & on mac for me, `build-essential` / `gcc` installed

---

Apologies, this I'm behind main on the `Dockerfile`, explictly adding `git` fixed it for me

title: Error Occurs When Sending a Chat After Including openaiPlugin
body:
**Describe the bug**

When attempting to send a chat after including the `openaiPlugin`, an error occurs with the message:  
```
action.validate is not a function
```

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behavior:  
1. Include the `openaiPlugin` in the project.  
2. Initialize the plugin and attempt to send a chat.  
3. Observe the error in the console or logs.

**Expected behavior**

The chat should be sent successfully without throwing any errors.

**Screenshots**

<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

**Additional context**

ENABLE_OPEN_AI_COMMUNITY_PLUGIN=true

title: Cannot access agents on local network IP running client with --host 0.0.0.0
body:
Am having issues running on a local network IP instead of "localhost", the agent is running fine on a local ubuntu server, which I used --host 0.0.0.0 to start the agent client in network mode so I can access it with a private IP,

It brings up the app fine at http://192.x.x.x/ but it wont connect to the agent

Checked in console and it's trying to access the agent at localhost instead of the IP

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbefdb3e-0771-4ac2-b5db-c6bc9bbeeed4)

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: Hello @jgarrettvml! Welcome to the elizaOS community. Thank you for opening your first issue; we appreciate your contribution. You are now an elizaOS contributor!

title: feat: add EmailClient Plugin
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
NA

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Currently, there's no built-in way for agents to handle email communications directly. This limits the agent's ability to engage in email-based workflows and automated email responses, which is essential for many business processes.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

NA

**Additional context**

This feature would be particularly useful for:

- Customer support automation
- Email-based workflow processing
- Automated response systems
- Business process automation
- Email notification handling

comments.author: github-actions
comments.body: Hello @jteso! Welcome to the elizaOS community. Thank you for opening your first issue; we appreciate your contribution. You are now an elizaOS contributor!

title: Sqlite3 error on Macbook with m3 chip
body:
Error on `pnpm start` after installing per docs

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

I think there's an issue with `better-sqlite3` on the m chip?

<!-- Steps to reproduce the behavior. -->

```
git clone https://github.com/elizaos/eliza-starter.git
cd eliza-starter
cp .env.example .env
pnpm i && pnpm build && pnpm start
```

ERROR output:
```
 ⛔ ERRORS
   Error starting agents:
   {"tries":["/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/build/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/build/Debug/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/build/Release/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/out/Debug/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/Debug/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/out/Release/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/Release/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/build/default/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/compiled/23.4.0/darwin/arm64/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/addon-build/release/install-root/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/addon-build/debug/install-root/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/addon-build/default/install-root/better_sqlite3.node","/Users/weylandjoyner/projects/eliza-starter/node_modules/.pnpm/better-sqlite3@11.5.0/node_modules/better-sqlite3/lib/binding/node-v131-darwin-arm64/better_sqlite3.node"]}
```

FIX from Claude:
```
pnpm add better-sqlite3@latest
cd node_modules/better-sqlite3
pnpm install
pnpm run build-release
cd ../..
```

title: Port TrustDB from SQLite to PostgreSQL
body:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

The current trust score database system primarily supports SQLite, and there is a need to extend it to support PostgreSQL-specific extensions without breaking existing functionality. The challenge is to ensure seamless integration while maintaining backward compatibility, handling potential async issues, and meeting performance expectations.

Describe the solution you'd like

The solution involves introducing PostgreSQL extensions through modular updates to the existing system. Key updates include:

Adding necessary dependencies in package.json.

Implementing trustscoreDb.getInstance() to dynamically initialize the appropriate database adapter. (Design consideration could be changed if showing issues)

Ensuring both PostgreSQL and SQLite functionalities coexist with proper fallbacks.

Describe alternatives you've considered

Considering the design approach as extenstion of database and arhitecture of using it should be easily added without breaking any existing structure 

Additional context

Upcoming development tasks include:

Testing

Address async function concerns.

Ensure PostgreSQL features work as expected.

Validate SQLite backward compatibility.

Measure and optimize performance.

Documentation

Provide detailed setup instructions.

Offer configuration options.

title: Vector Dimension error - after using GAIANET for the LLM
body:
After trying to use different embeddings (gaianet set to TRUE) after running the same character with GROQ, when using GROQ the agent worked fine and i got answers from the LLM, now i get this error when starting the character:

```
⛔ ERRORS
   Error starting agent for character Dobby: 
   {"code":"SQLITE_ERROR"} 

 ["⛔ SqliteError: Vector dimension mistmatch. First vector has 768 dimensions, while the second has 384 dimensions."] 

 ⛔ ERRORS
   Error starting agents: 
   {"code":"SQLITE_ERROR"}
```

The client connects and gives the connected info, but no agent to select on the sidebar
